This game is the equivalent of a brownie, that's been topped with ice cream that has toppings that were then topped with whipped cream, and then smothered under the all delicious cake.
Now that we're done with the real review, let's get down to business:
Portal: great! but short
Portal 2: Great!! and longer
Portal: blood
Portal 2: no blood
Portal: little language
Portal 2: some language, but it was to give character depth to .................
Portal: good graphics
Portal 2:great graphics
Portal: It has a shtick
Portal 2: It has shticks on top of shticks\
Portal: It has an in-depth story
Portal 2: it's the sequel, it adds an in-depth story to the other in-depth story
overall: they made a perfect game even better in the sequel. Buy both.

Muito bom, sem mais: gameplay interessante, bem executado, boa escrita, um dos poucos jogos que tenta ser engraçado, e consegue. Mesmo depois de terminar a campanha, tem conteúdo extra com o modo cooperativo, e os mapas feitos pela comunidade. Falar tudo isso é chover no molhado, porque provavelmente todo mundo que usa a plataforma da Valve já sabe dos jogos da Valve, e eu acho que se alguém passa tempo suficiente na Steam sem comprar os jogos da Valve, Gabe Newell os faz brotarem na sua biblioteca. Eu nem lembro de ter comprado Portal 1 e 2, nem Left 4 Dead 2, nem todos os Half-Life; nem sei mais o que é realidade, para ser sincero, e todo esse existencialismo em Portal 2 não fez bem para a minha cabeça.

Portal 2 like Portal 1 is a puzzle/platformer. This installment has Chell wake up a long time after she makes GLaDoS commit destroy enrichment centre. She meets Wheatly and finds out the secrets of Aperture Science. Wheatly then goes nuts and causes chaos. Chell and GLaDoS make a portal to the moon and Wheatly gets SUCC into space and the end. This game has a lot more secrets and has a co-op campaghn, and a test room builder, and access to the Steam Workshop so you can post your test rooms around the world!

I cannot tell you how many times I've played this game either on Steam or Xbox. The level designs and story are seriously well thought out, and I can say that Portal 2 has made my top 5 list of favorite all time games. I highly recommend this one for anyone itching for a critical thinking game that'll have you stumped on several occasions. 11/10
